description.narrative: 37 million people are living with HIV globally and need continuous access to antiretroviral therapy. Treatment successfully suppresses HIV replication but does not eliminate the latent reservoir and virus replication rapidly resumes if treatment is interrupted. Consequently, lifelong treatment is required and ongoing stigma, toxicity and costs urge an active search for curative strategies. This proposal optimally utilizes the individual and complementary expertise from scientist, clinicians, the active HIV community and the excellent Dutch medical infrastructure to form the NL4Cure consortium aiming at accelerating HIV cure. We propose a comprehensive study in which a unique series of latency reversing agents to purge the viral reservoir are combined with novel immunological interventions to boost HIV-specific immune responses. This innovative approach will be evaluated in a clinical phase I study in treated HIV-infected individuals with the most promising strategy that has been identified in in vitro, ex vivo and in vivo models.
Contactpersoon mbt dierproeven is Ben Berkhout - AMC

mailing-address.narrative: Aidsfonds - Soa Aids Nederland, Condensatorweg 54, 1014 AX Amsterdam
